What can we help you find?
Ready to apply to Montclair State? Great!
Applications for undergraduate admissions are accepted and reviewed on a rolling basis.

Montclair State University considers a number of factors in reviewing admissions applications. Well-qualified candidates for admission have a 3.2 or higher cumulative high school GPA on an unweighted, 4.0 scale, a challenging course load (particularly in junior and senior years), and a variety of extracurricular activities.
Submission of SAT or ACT scores is not required, but, if you chose to submit those scores, they will be considered in the admissions process.

Other factors considered in our holistic review process include: strong letters of recommendation from teachers and/or counselors; a well-written, thoughtful admissions essay; and a commitment to extracurricular engagement, both in school and in the community.

Academic Programs from Accounting to Visual Arts

Montclair State offers more than 300 doctoral, master’s and baccalaureate-level programs. From Accounting to Visual Arts, our 11 colleges and schools provide exciting academic challenges for 21,000 students.

What can we help you find today?
Our curated index of pages, people, majors, minors and locations will help you find exactly what you’re looking for.

When you give to Montclair State University, you make great things happen. Your contribution to The Fund for Montclair State has a direct and meaningful impact on the lives of 21,000 talented students who call Montclair State their home. Every gift helps Soar, The Campaign for Montclair State University, to advance our students and our future. Help us to continue to provide extraordinary educational opportunities to our extraordinary students. Let’s Soar, together!
